intro: Stenandrium goiasense, commonly known as the Goiás stenandrium, is a rare and endemic species native to the Brazilian Cerrado. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and broad, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within its native habitat. Its botanical significance lies in its unique adaptations to the tropical savanna ecosystem. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts.
